intro: Verbesina baccharidea, commonly known as yellow beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often have a hairy texture. Verbesina baccharidea is often found in moist, open habitats like roadsides and wetlands.
